Comments_List: Became more fluent in the language.

I continued to develop my vocabulary and sense of language conventions, but we also had the opportunity to really dive deep into several cultural, political, and historical topics related to Indonesia.

Great professor, strong curriculum,
No weaknesses

The strengths of this course are the small size, since it allows for interesting conversations and the ability for students to investigate topics interesting to them. The only thing that could be improved would maybe be to cover more topics, since there's only so much time, but we are looking forward to expanding the topics next semester.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student. I love Indonesian. It is the best class at Yale.

Anyone who has developed some comfort with the Indonesian language should take this class to learn more about the country itself. Bu Dinny is the most dedicated instructor I've ever had, and class itself is always fun.
